title: Quality Assurance / Quality Control Personnel Job at Prestigious Homes Limited
content:
Prestigious Homes Limited is a luxury-home builder, delivering homes to their owners just the way they envisioned it. We create incredible majestic homes with superior craftsmanship, exquisite architectural designs, and the finest interior finishing. We expand our clients' imagination to countless features and details that bear a distinctive elegance and sophistication. We believe every building must be environmentally friendly and green and our clients come back rejoicing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance / Quality Control Personnel

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos.
Industry: Real Estate Development.

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Do you have an eagle eye for detail and a firm grasp of construction standards and finishing excellence? We’re seeking a highly experienced QA/QC Engineer to oversee and enforce top-tier quality assurance and control across our sites.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure that all construction and finishing works meet approved quality standards and project specifications
	Conduct routine inspections and audits on materials, workmanship, and processes
	Establish QA/QC plans, site checklists, and standard documentation procedures
	Maintain detailed reports on site conditions, deviations, and corrective actions
	Supervise snag lists, punch lists, and ensure timely closures
	Collaborate closely with site engineers, architects, and subcontractors
	Support handover processes with clear QA/QC documentation


Requirements


	Minimum of 10 years of experience in a QA/QC role, especially in building construction and finishing
	Strong knowledge of building codes, structural detailing, finishes, and MEP coordination
	Experience working with premium projects and reputable companies in construction or real estate
	Proficiency in QA/QC reporting tools and snagging software (e.g., Procore, PlanGrid, etc.)
	Excellent communication, documentation, and leadership skills
	Meticulous attention to detail, with a proactive mindset


Ideal Candidate:


	Has a deep understanding of both structural works and interior finishes
	Can uphold quality under pressure and ensure zero-compromise delivery
	Brings a professional, no-shortcuts attitude to every stage of the project


Remuneration
Attractive and Competitive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed Resume to: hr@prestigioushomeslimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Accountant Job at Excellent Jobs
content:
Excellent Jobs is a consulting andrecruitment firm, dedicated to hiring and managing great talents for its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Magboro, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	As an Account Officer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the financial health and compliance of our organization.
	You will be responsible for managing financial transactions, maintaining accurate records, and collaborating with other departments to support the overall financial operations.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for the organization.
	Record daily financial transactions, including expenses, revenue, and bank deposits.
	Assist in the preparation and management of budgets to ensure efficient financial planning and control.
	Assist in financial audits by providing relevant documentation and explanations to auditors.
	Prepare regular financial reports, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements, for management and stakeholders.
	Investigate and explain discrepancies between budgeted and actual financial performance.
	Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for cost savings or revenue generation.
	Prepare and file tax returns, ensuring compliance with tax laws and regulations.
	Handle payroll activities, including calculating salaries, deductions, and tax withholdings.
	Monitor and control expenses to ensure they align with the budget and company policies.
	Use historical data and financial trends to forecast future financial performance.
	Utilize accounting software and tools to streamline financial processes and maintain data accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards, laws, and regulations in financial reporting and transactions.
	Manage cash flow by monitoring accounts receivable and payable and optimizing cash reserves.
	Provide financial advice and recommendations to management for decision-making, such as investment opportunities or cost-saving strategies.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree or its equivalent in accounting, finance, or a related field.
	Professional certification such as Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Chartered Accountant (CA).
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, Oracle) and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
	Knowledge of relevant accounting principles and regulations.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Ethical behavior and a commitment to maintaining confidentiality.


Required Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Organizational skills
	Time management skills


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: excellentjobs95@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: General Manager Job at Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited
content:
Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited is a leading real estate firm based in Lagos, Nigeria, specializing in property development, investment, and marketing. We are committed to providing top-notch services that connect clients with the best real estate opportunities, ensuring transparency, innovation, and excellence in all our dealings. At Yemsays, we pride ourselves on our dynamic team, which works tirelessly to deliver exceptional results. We foster a collaborative and professional work environment where every team member’s input is valued and growth is encouraged.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As our General Manager, you will drive the company’s sales growth, team performance, and operational execution, reporting directly to the CEO. This role requires a highly strategic thinker with strong leadership skills, industry experience, and the ability to drive results across all departments.


Key Responsibilties


	Oversee daily operations across departments (sales, marketing, admin, client relations)
	Set and monitor performance KPIs for the entire team
	Lead and coordinate strategic property marketing campaigns
	Supervise real estate consultants, interns, and marketing officers
	Yemsays Properties and Investment Limited
	Represent the company at events, client meetings, and site inspections
	Ensure smooth project execution and timely delivery


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Admin, Marketing, Estate Management, or similar (MBA is a plus)
	Proven experience as a General Manager or senior leadership role in real estate marketing
	Strong leadership, sales, and administrative management skills
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and people management skills
	Tech-savvy and comfortable with CRM tools, digital reporting, and collaboration software
	Resides around Ajah, Sangotedo, Abraham Adesanya, or Lekki Axis.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary + performance bonuses
	Supportive leadership and growth opportunities
	Dynamic work culture with a strong digital focus
	The chance to lead and make real impact in a fast-growing real estate firm


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short cover letter explaining your fit for the role to: yemsaysproperties@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email (E:g "General Manager Application – [Your Name]").

title: Reservation / Front Office Staff Job at Divine AG Solutions Limited
content:
Divine AG Solutions Limited (RC 1243335) was incorporated in 2015 to provide recruitment and outsourcing services in accordance with the terms agreed between us and our clients. Our goal is to meet the needs of our clients ranging from individual clients, government parastatals, corporate organizations, manufacturing companies, public sectors/organizations, hotels, churches as well as multinationals companies and corporations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Reservation / Front Office Staff

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Reservations Management:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Handle room and restaurant reservations via phone, email, online booking platforms, and walk-ins.
	Confirm bookings, process payments or deposits, and send confirmation details.
	Update reservation systems with accurate booking data.
	Monitor room and table availability and avoid overbooking situations.
	Coordinate with housekeeping, maintenance, and restaurant staff for guest readiness.


Customer Service:


	Greet residents, guests, and diners warmly and assist with check-ins, check-outs, and seating.
	Provide information about apartment amenities, restaurant offerings, local attractions, and services.
	Respond to inquiries, concerns, or complaints in a courteous and professional manner.
	Assist with special requests such as early check-in, late check-out, dietary preferences, or event arrangements.
	Record and report feedback to improve services.


Administrative Duties:


	Maintain accurate records of guest interactions, payments, and complaints.
	Assist with billing, invoicing, refunds, and basic accounting tasks when required.
	Manage guest databases, including frequent visitor preferences and contact information.
	Prepare daily arrival/departure and reservation reports for management.


Collaboration:


	Work closely with the housekeeping team to ensure rooms are ready for new guests.
	Liaise with the restaurant staff to coordinate reservations, private events, and peak-time planning.
	Support marketing efforts by promoting special offers, events, or loyalty programs to guests.


Qualifications


	Previous experience in reservations, front desk, or customer service (hotel or restaurant environment preferred).
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Fluent in English; additional languages are a plus.


Key Attributes:


	Warm and professional demeanor.
	Attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to multitask and stay calm under pressure.
	A proactive, team-oriented approach to guest satisfaction.


Salary
N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: divineagsolutionsltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
